title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 69-3.11 - Failure to obtain required immunization
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 69-3.11 - Failure to obtain required immunization

State Regulations

Barring a valid medical contraindication or religious exemption from hepatitis B immunization, if the parent or legal guardian of a child born to a woman with a positive HBsAg test result is unwilling to have the infant immunized, the health care provider attending the child, or the local health officer if vaccine is to be administered under section 3.8 of this Subpart, shall make a report of suspected child abuse or maltreatment (see section
415
of the Social Services Law). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
69-3.11

New

York State Register November 13, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 46, eff. 11/13/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
